response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [CHUNK_4] The bill amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses, and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale and consumption by the drink. [CHUNK_5] The description provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [CHUNK_8]",
  "appropriations": "The provided documents do not contain any information regarding appropriations. [CHUNK_0]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The provided documents do not contain any financial projections, cost estimations, or methodologies. [CHUNK_0]",
  "agency_impact": "This Act would affect the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county by requiring them to deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [CHUNK_8] Section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but this measure extends it to the renewal of current licenses. [CHUNK_2] The provided documents do not detail any further operational, administrative, or budgetary impacts on the agencies. [CHUNK_0]",
  "economic_impact": "The legislature finds that patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents and users of nearby public facilities. [CHUNK_1] The purpose of the Act is to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons do not interfere with minors or other residents. [CHUNK_2] The provided documents do not contain information regarding any other economic effects of the measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "policy_impact": "This Act amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to apply to the renewal of existing liquor licenses. [CHUNK_5] The legislature finds that the statute currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor for existing establishments. [CHUNK_2] The purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [CHUNK_4]",
  "revenue_sources": "The provided documents do not identify any revenue sources related to this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding a six-year fiscal outlook for this measure. [CHUNK_0] The bill's purpose is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [CHUNK_4] It amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, concerning the issuance and renewal of liquor licenses. [CHUNK_5] No recurring expenses, staffing changes, or program expansion costs are mentioned in the provided text. [CHUNK_0] The documents do not provide any data to project costs over a multi-year period. [CHUNK_0] The Act is set to take effect upon its approval, but no fiscal details are provided. [CHUNK_7] Therefore, it is not possible to determine the six-year fiscal implications from the text. [CHUNK_0]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding any anticipated impacts on operating revenues. [CHUNK_0]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The provided documents do not outline any expected capital expenditures related to this measure. [CHUNK_0]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding ongoing fiscal obligations or implications after a six-year period. [CHUNK_0]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison. [CHUNK_0]"
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB2 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 2 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO LIQUOR LICENSES . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: SECTION 1. The legislature finds that patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents

patrons leaving a liquor establishment can adversely affect neighboring residents and users of nearby public facilities. The legislature enacted section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which allows for the denial or restriction of liquor licenses for certain establishments near schools or parks, to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons

parks, to promote an environment in which alcohol imbibing patrons do not interfere with minors or other residents. The legislature further finds that section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor

the renewal of current licenses, thus creating a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license. Although registered voters within five hundred feet of a liquor establishment may not be inclined to protest the initial issuance of a liquor license, they may wish to do so

of a liquor license, they may wish to do so when the license becomes subject to renewal and they have learned more about the establishment. Accordingly, the purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. SECTION 2 . Section 281-39.5,

renewal of certain liquor licenses. SECTION 2 . Section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by amending subsection (b) to read as follows: "(b) This section shall apply [ only ] to both the issuance of new liquor licenses , and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale

and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale and consumption by the drink [ and not to any renewal of such licenses ]." SECTION 3. This Act does not affect rights and duties that matured, penalties that were incurred, and proceedings that were begun before its effective date.

incurred, and proceedings that were begun before its effective date. SECTION 4. Statutory material to be repealed is bracketed and stricken. New statutory material is underscored. SECTION 5. This Act shall take effect upon its approval. INTRODUCED BY: _____________________________ Report Title: Liquor Licenses; Renewal; Protest; Denial Description: Provides that the

Title: Liquor Licenses; Renewal; Protest; Denial Description: Provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not
this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.
